SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the clockwise direction from Carbon Footprint Reduction Rate?
SRP.A: The next dimension clockwise from Carbon Footprint Reduction Rate is Green Building Certification Rate

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the counterclockwise direction from Green Building Certification Rate?
SRP.A: The next dimension counterclockwise from Carbon Footprint Reduction Rate is Water Conservation Efficiency Rate.

SRP.Q: On the Water Conservation Efficiency Rate, is the point for Calderon, Scott and Sullivan Sustainability Initiative inside or outside the point for Parker and Sons Sustainability Initiative?
SRP.A: On the Water Conservation Efficiency Rate, the point for Calderon, Scott and Sullivan Sustainability Initiative is inside the point for Parker and Sons Sustainability Initiative.

VPR.Q: Which label encloses the largest score in the radar chart?
VPR.A: label {Recycling Material Utilization Rate} encloses the largest score

VPR.Q: What are the strongest and weakest dimension of Parker and Sons Sustainability Initiative?
VPR.A: The strongest aspect is {Recycling Material Utilization Rate}, while the weakest aspect is{ Eco-Friendly Product Sales Growth Rate}.

VPR.Q: On dimension Waste-to-Energy Conversion Rate, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Waste-to-Energy Conversion Rate, label {Parker and Sons Sustainability Initiative} scores the highest.

VPR.Q: On dimension Eco-Friendly Product Sales Growth Rate, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Eco-Friendly Product Sales Growth Rate, label {Parker and Sons Sustainability Initiative} scores the lowest.

NC.A: {Recycling Material Utilization Rate} has a higher score than Eco-Friendly Product Sales Growth Rate for Calderon, Scott and Sullivan Sustainability Initiative.

NC.Q: For Calderon, Scott and Sullivan Sustainability Initiative, which dimension has a higher score: Sustainable Packaging Adoption Rate or Eco-Friendly Product Sales Growth Rate?

MSR.Q: For Calderon, Scott and Sullivan Sustainability Initiative, based on the data shown in the radar chart, which dimension does it most need to improve?
MSR.A: Calderon, Scott and Sullivan Sustainability Initiative most needs to improve its {Water Conservation Efficiency Rate}.
